title: Internet Computer Launches ckUSDC Sepolia, an ICP Copy of USDC in ckERC20 Token Standard
content: The testing version of the ckETH minter on Internet Computer (ICP)Â mainnet has been upgraded, now featuring the Sepolia version of the USDC token.

In aÂ recent forum post, Christian MÃ¼ller, Senior Software Engineer at DFINITY, revealed that users can obtain Sepolia ETH from various faucets available online and Sepolia USDC to engage with the Sepolia ETH and USDC tokens.
Once acquired, users can deposit both Sepolia ETH and USDC to mint ckETH and ckUSDC, respectively.Â
DFINITY Foundation is a not-for-profit organization developing technology for the Internet Computer (ICP) blockchain.
It’s important to note that while ckETH is not required to deposit USDC, it is necessary to withdraw ckUSDC and receive USDC back.Â
Additionally, a portion of the ckSepoliaETH will be used by the minter canister to cover transfer transactions on the Sepolia testnet.
The canister IDs of the ckSepoliaETH minter are also available for reference.Â
Furthermore, the ckSepoliaETH minter offers a dashboard displaying conversions and corresponding Ethereum transactions for both ckETH and ckERC20 transactions.Â
